page.title: 05A QUIET LIFE...
page.content: Home life and living in a rural area such as Alvington is very relaxed and easy going. Life is very simple. The dialect is west country. Most households have pets, mainly cats and dogs, some chickens, a few goats and the odd pony. In this area all houses have gardens which are large enough to grow their own produce. Fresh vegetables help greatly with the family budget. Households fortunate enough to have a home freezer freeze excess fruit and vegetables. The total population of Alvington in 1984 was 612. This consists of 498 adults and 114 children under the age of 16. Because of government policy of centralisation and economy the one and only school in Alvington has been closed and converted into two houses.
